description.p: You had two passions growing up: history and magic. Your teachers saw your interest in all things old and magical, and ensured that your potential was nurtured. Your mission in life is to discover the secrets of the past, both magical and mundane – and you are ready to risk your life in the pursuit of discovery. You knew of the Guild of Antiquarians, of course, but you wanted more from life than being stuck in a library all day. So, you took your backpack and set out to discover the wonders of Solasta for yourself.

ul.li: Equipment: Common clothes, a notebook to keep track of your adventures, 25 gp.

description.p: Academics are shaped by what they read and the teachers with whom they study. Their interests and researches affect their reactions and mannerisms. Their flaws can be some fringe idea taken to an extreme, or a trait that is harmless in the sheltered world of academia but can cause problems elsewhere.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: A book is an irresistible distraction for me.
I quote academic texts in every possible situation. An unsupported assertion is suspect.
I take a long time to think before speaking, making sure I have considered every angle.
I am tolerant (or intolerant) of other fields of study and respect (or dismiss) those who study them.
I am competitive, and often challenge others to tests of knowledge.
I am fiercely loyal to my alma mater, and will defend its honor at all costs.
I dislike the so-called ‘real world’, preferring a secluded life of the mind.
I know no fear, for my thirst for discovery overrides all other considerations.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Knowledge. Everything is knowledge, and knowledge is everything.
Education. Knowledge is useless unless it is shared.
Prestige. I am determined to be the most respected scholar in my – or any – field.
Power. Knowledge is power, and power belongs in the hands of the educated.
Progress. Increased knowledge improves life for everyone, even if practical applications are not immediately apparent.
Loyalty. I am the first in my family to become an academic, and I am determined to make them proud.

select.name: Bond
select.item: I have an academic rival whom I am determined to surpass.
There is a particular mystery blocking progress in my field of study, and I am determined to be the one who solves it.
My teachers and fellow students looked down on me for some reason, and I will have my revenge.
Everything I learn is to help improve life for everyone – not just other academics.
My mentor died before cracking a particular problem, and I will solve it in his or her honor.
My particular field of study is considered foolish by mainstream academics, but I will prove them wrong.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I am not interested in anything outside my own narrow research field.
I am absent-minded, and hopeless at day-to-day tasks.
I find non-academics puzzling, and have difficulty dealing with them.
I have an unthinking habit of correcting errors in others’ grammar and thinking.
I question everything I am told, and must find the truth through logical inquiry.
My devotion to my studies means I know far less than the average person about anything outside my field.

description.p: You were once being considered for acceptance into a scholarly organization such as the Guild of Antiquarians, and had a mentor who sponsored you, but you decided not to enlist. You still have ties to the organization and to your former mentor. Relations could be friendly, or they might be strained because of your refusal.

sheet.description: You were once being considered for acceptance into a scholarly organization such as the Guild of Antiquarians, and had a mentor who sponsored you, but you decided not to enlist. You still have ties to the organization and to your former mentor. Relations could be friendly, or they might be strained because of your refusal.

description.p: Born among the lords of your people, you have received a higher education. Your manners and speech are formal and rigid, and you have difficulties when dealing with low-ranking individuals. A life of privilege gave you enough perks to start your adventuring life with a comfortable package.

ul.li: Equipment: Fine clothes, a sigil ring of your family, 40 gp.

description.p: Raised in a life of wealth and privilege, aristocrats often have trouble adjusting to harsher realities. Their attitudes and mannerisms reflect this, and their flaws often revolve around the dissonance between the world they are used to and the world they encounter.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I like the finer things in life, and will not accept food, drink, lodging, or anything else that is less than the very best.
I treat the lower orders with kindness. They can’t help being poor, ignorant, and unable to help themselves.
I have an unshakeable faith in my own quality to see me through any situation.
My family is renowned and respected, but it can climb higher. I will see to it that it does.
I find the lower orders a little threatening, and avoid them when I can.
I find the lower orders interesting, and actively try to make their acquaintance.
I know the aristocracy exists only as long as the social order is maintained, and try to avoid upsetting the balance of things.
I live to be an example to others – especially the lower classes.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Tradition. Society must remain as it is, despite what others may claim. Any deviation from tradition threatens to plunge society into chaos.
Power. Power must remain in the hands of those who are best suited, by breeding and education, to wield it.
Inherent Quality. Those born into the aristocracy are inherently superior to others in every way.
Faith. The gods placed some mortals above others, and they did so for a reason.
Charity. Just as a shepherd must care for the sheep, an aristocrat must take care of those less fortunate.
Loyalty. Any word of deed that casts a blot on the family name is unforgivable.

select.name: Bond
select.item: My family disowned me for some trifling misdeed. I will have my revenge.
My worthless brother stands to inherit everything, unless I can outshine him in some way that the family cannot ignore.
My family has fallen on hard times, and I must rebuild its wealth, power, and prestige.
I am devoted to a group of friends from my college days (or my military service), and act as though those days never ended.
I will have justice from the political rivals who murdered my parents and cast my family down for their own gain.
I am the last of my line. If it must go extinct with me, it will go out in a blaze of glory.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I am a snob, and look down anyone who is not an aristocrat.
I am competitive, and will try to best any fellow aristocrat in some way.
I cannot resist good food and drink, and will binge to excess.
My loyalty to my family (or my ambition) leads me to be too ruthless at some times and too trusting at others.
I see others as expendable, especially if they are not aristocrats.
My personal code of honor sometimes leads me to take unnecessary risks.

description.p: People from the nobility recognize you as one of them. They may even know your family and title, which can be helpful in some situations.

sheet.description: People from the nobility recognize you as one of them. They may even know your family and title, which can be helpful in some situations.

description.p: You have an instinct for spotting trouble and the force of personality to nip it in the bud. As a deputy, you learned how to spot a lie and how to discourage a troublemaker with nothing but a cold-eyed stare. And if keeping the peace and protecting the innocent required you to break a few heads, you were ready. After a while, though, dealing with petty criminals every day just wasn’t enough. You took what you had learned and embarked on a life of travel and discovery. The Marches and the Badlands have a whole different level of lawlessness – enough to keep you interested, you’re certain.

ul.li: Equipment: Common clothes, a lawkeeper’s badge from your home, 10 gp.

description.p: Lawkeepers are shaped by their service in a city watch or other law enforcement organization, and their behavior is often based on their perception of circumstances in terms of crime and punishment. Their flaws are often traits that serve them well when pursuing and capturing criminals, but are less useful in other contexts.

setters.set: Perception, Intimidation, Martial Weapons, and 1 language

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I speak little and listen constantly.
I maintain eye contact longer than most people find comfortable.
I am not above getting my hands dirty.
I would rather prevent crimes and reform criminals than investigate and punish.
I pretend to be less intelligent than I am, so people will underestimate me.
I prefer the fringes of society, where it’s just me and the criminals.
I trust no one, and believe no one.
I consider myself a student of human nature.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: I consider myself a student of human nature.
Justice. Sometimes it is necessary to break the law in order to obtain justice.
Respect. The system only works if those below respect those above.
Vengeance. Make an example of one criminal, and you deter a dozen others.
Honor. Wrongs must be righted – always.
Protection. The law exists to protect the weak from the strong.

select.name: Bond
select.item: I will someday get even with those who framed me for a crime I did not commit.
I exposed corruption and paid the price. Those I crossed will send people after me.
I am haunted by the one case I couldn’t solve.
The criminals and I are locked in an endless dance. No one else matters.
I serve the common people, who look to the law for protection.
I saw my parents murdered, and vowed to protect others.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I judge everyone harshly, including myself. No one is perfect, and that bothers me.
I lose track of the line between reasonable force and wanton violence.
I trust no one – not even fellow lawkeepers.
I see the bad in everyone and the good in no one.
I have too much confidence in my own reasoning.
I need people to respect me – but I’ll settle for being feared.

description.p: Your history as a lawkeeper gives you additional influence with certain bodies in your home. You have advantage when making Persuasion checks in dealings with the law enforcement authorities of your home nation.

sheet.description: Your history as a lawkeeper gives you additional influence with certain bodies in your home. You have advantage when making Persuasion checks in dealings with the law enforcement authorities of your home nation.

description.p: Born in the streets, you have always been discarded by most commoners, and learned to survive with close to nothing. This made you a tough and resolved individual. Manners and education are not your strong suit, but you have learned to compensate with other qualities.

ul.li: Skill Proficiencies: Sleight of Hand, Deception

description.p: Lowlifes have grown up in the underworld of the poor and the criminal. They learned early that the world gives nothing away, and are governed primarily by self-interest. Their flaws can stem from their limited view of the world or their flexible sense of morality.

setters.set: Sleight of Hand, Deception, Thieves' Tools

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: My eyes are constantly darting from side to side, looking for threats and potential exits.
I seem to be half-asleep sometimes, so people will underestimate me.
I hold people’s gaze until they become uncomfortable.
I have a habit of cleaning under my nails with a dagger as I speak.
I take trouble to avoid being noticed.
I dislike anyone richer than I am, and scheme to take something from them.
I am not devout, but I have a superstitious belief in luck.
I am uncomfortable in clean and well-lit surroundings.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Profit. No one says money isn’t everything unless they are comfortably off.
Class Strife. The rich and the poor have always been at odds.
Reputation. It is good to be respected, and better to be feared.
Justice. Rob the rich to feed the poor and you’ll always have friends.
Ambition. One day, I’m going to run this town.
Strength. There are those who do what it takes, and those who don’t last.

select.name: Bond
select.item: I can count on my crew whenever I am in my old neighborhood.
There’s a price on my head, and people are after me.
I first stole to feed my family, and they are still my main priority.
I have a dangerous rival somewhere in the underworld.
I was raised in an orphanage, and still feel a bond with it.
There’s a legendary treasure that I just can’t get out of my head.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I can’t warm to anyone of a higher social status.
The prospect of a rich haul can make me greedy and careless.
I take unnecessary risks in order to build a legend.
I sometimes think I’m cleverer than I actually am.
I trust no one except myself.
I believe a little too much in “honor among thieves”.

description.p: You have ties with the underworld, whether you like or not. You know the rules and codes of the streets and can deal with the criminal community easily. You have advantage when making Persuasion checks in dealings with the underworld of your home nation.

sheet.description: You have ties with the underworld, whether you like or not. You know the rules and codes of the streets and can deal with the criminal community easily. You have advantage when making Persuasion checks in dealings with the underworld of your home nation.

description.p: You have spent almost all of your life reading books and learning about the world of Solasta – and even other worlds. You are passionate about knowledge and an expert when it comes to study. Now you’ve decided to take a new path, to explore and discover the world by yourself.

ul.li: Equipment: Common clothes, herbalism kit, 20 gp.

description.p: Philosophers are shaped by their education much as academics are, but generally have a less inward-looking view. To them, almost everything is a source of interest, and their thirst for knowledge drives almost every thought and action. Their flaws tend to be an extension of their attitudes, which are not helpful in every situation.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I speak at great length about everything, using the longest words I know.
I prefer books to people.
I speak in aphorisms, making them up if necessary.
I am unhappy in dirty and uncomfortable places.
I am always focused on the big picture rather than the day-to-day reality.
I am intolerant of those who cannot hold their own in philosophical discourse.
I became disillusioned with academic study, and prefer to learn from experience.
I am happier among nature than in a library.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Understanding. The purpose of living is to know the world and understand how it works.
Learning. Learning is living. Stop learning, and you begin to die.
The World. The world has a lot of offer to one who can live in harmony with it.
Curiosity. There is a whole world out there, full of people to meet and things to know.
Ambition. The greatest philosophers are not in the past. They are yet to come, and I will be one of them.
Faith. I respect the gods, but my true faith is knowledge.

select.name: Bond
select.item: I idolize a particular classical philosopher and see everything through the lens of their teachings.
I have heard of some lost works by an ancient philosopher, and have become obsessed with finding them.
I will do anything to advance current knowledge in my chosen field of study.
I am fanatically loyal to a particular mentor or alma mater.
A philosophical problem has intrigued me since my earliest studies. I will solve it.
Legend tells of a herb (or some other substance) that everyone today believes is just a myth. I will prove them wrong.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I can’t resist explaining something to someone – even if they know more about it than I do.
I expect reality to match theory every time, and am confused when it does not.
I am often absent-minded, lost in my own thoughts.
When I start a research project, nothing can sway me until it is finished.
If something takes my interest, I lose sight of everything else – including my own safety.
My faith in reason can lead me to false conclusions, for the world is not always logical.

description.p: Unlike most of your former classmates, you have chosen the path of adventure, making you much more practical and efficient when it comes to finding useful plants in the wild. You collect plants and craft potions 25% faster than anyone spending his life in a lab.

sheet.description: Unlike most of your former classmates, you have chosen the path of adventure, making you much more practical and efficient when it comes to finding useful plants in the wild. You collect plants and craft potions 25% faster than anyone spending his life in a lab.

description.p: You spent your youth in a mercenary company, and ever since your fighting skills have been available to whoever can afford them. Bloodshed and companionship have forged your character and made you both tough and bitter.

ul.li: Equipment: Worn clothes, a ribbon from a past military campaign, 10 gp.

description.p: Sellswords have been hardened by years of service, seeing others less tough than themselves fall by the wayside. Their own toughness is sometimes an advantage and sometimes a problem. Many of their flaws stem from traits that have been over-developed by their harsh lives.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I take little interest in others, unless I am planning to fight them.
Everything is a job for pay. I have no other interests.
have seen more than most, and am impossible to impress or overawe.
I like food and drink to be plentiful rather than fancy.
I can sleep anywhere at a moment’s notice, and wake up fully alert.
I am slow to warm to people, but loyal once I do.
I like to impress others with tales of my exploits.
I am always on the lookout for my next job.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Victory. In this life, you either win or you die. I intend to live.
Courage. Mental weakness is more dangerous than any wound.
Reputation. A good name brings good work, and a legend lets you set your own terms.
Ambition. There are no old sellswords. I plan to win or buy some land and climb the ladder.
Pragmatism. If it works, it’s good. If it doesn’t, it’s bad. That is the whole of my morality.
Luxury. Fighting is hard and dirty work. I intend to enjoy the fruits of my victories.

select.name: Bond
select.item: Somewhere out there is a foe I failed to beat. For now.
A sworn enemy is on my trail. I must be ready for them.
I’ll fight for anyone who pays, but there is one cause that is dear to my heart.
I long to re-establish a dissolved mercenary company of which I was once a member.
There is a particular nation, or species, or other kind of enemy for which I harbor a particular hatred.
I still feel a bond of loyalty toward a particular nation, or species, or other class of person with which I was once close.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I am so hard-hearted I find it difficult to enjoy anything.
I sometimes lose control in combat and become frighteningly violent.
I trust no one and have few close friendships.
I find it hard to settle down in one place.
I am sometimes troubled by nightmares.
I am quick to see someone or something as a threat, even if they are not.

description.p: You have been a soldier all your life, and everyone who knows soldiers and soldiering can see it. This gives you advantage when talking to guards, soldiers and officers.

sheet.description: You have been a soldier all your life, and everyone who knows soldiers and soldiering can see it. This gives you advantage when talking to guards, soldiers and officers.

description.p: You have spent years working as a low-level diplomatic aide, learning the tricks or spycraft between the Principality, the New Empire, and the Kingdom of Gallivan. You have chosen not to take side and never became an official spy, but you have retained the skills necessary for your emancipation.

ul.li: Equipment: Fine clothes, poisoner’s Kit, 25 gp.

description.p: Subtle and charming, spies focus on manipulating others while avoiding being manipulated themselves. Masters of complex situations and cunning stratagems, their suspicious natures are often useful in their professional life but make them less well suited to other situations.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: I find it easy to adopt a false persona.
I never tell anyone anything true about myself.
I am a charming conversationalist, drawing people out without their realizing it.
I am at ease with all kinds of people, from the highest to the lowest.
I listen more closely than I seem to, no matter who is speaking.
I always sit with my back to a wall and a clear view of all entrances.
I am very creative and resourceful, especially under stress.
I never say die.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: Information. Information is everything. Having it, trading it, and keeping it from others is the only true power.
Survival. Nothing else matters, and anything I do to stay alive is justifiable.
Caution. Anyone who knows me can hurt me.
The Mission. If I set out to get something, I get it. Always.
Reputation. I need to be trusted by people who trust no one, which means I can never afford to fail.
Patriotism. I do what I do out of loyalty, and so no one else needs to soil their hands.

select.name: Bond
select.item: I have a very useful and highly-placed asset somewhere, who must be protected at all costs.
I crossed an agent – or worse, a nation – and now my life is in danger.
I came so close to acquiring some vital information before being thwarted. I am determined to get it.
I was framed by some unknown person and cast out of my agency. I need to find out who and why, and get my position back.
I have a strange, love-hate relationship with a rival agent who has crossed my path more than once.
I have a mentor who is now retired – officially, at least – but amassed many enemies over a long career.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: I am always looking for complexity, and can overlook simple explanations and solutions.
I have been someone else so many times, and for so long, I am not sure who I truly am.
I instinctively avoid telling anyone anything, even if they are a friend.
I have no true friends – just people I use.
I have no heart, and sometimes this worries me – but perhaps not as much as it should.
I have no problem doing things that others would find horrifying.

description.p: You’ve lived in the shadows long enough to recognize a fellow spy when you see one. You can communicate secretly with other spies using a secret language of keywords and subtle gestures.

sheet.description: You’ve lived in the shadows long enough to recognize a fellow spy when you see one. You can communicate secretly with other spies using a secret language of keywords and subtle gestures.
